Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful I stayed in the Saphir Mabisa two times now and both stays were excellent. If you are used to a 5 star hotel I should not go to the saphir mabisa, but for me this is perfect. The staff is very, very friendly and breakfast and lunch is perfect. The hotel looks a bit like it needs a renovation but that does not influence the nice feeling I get when I stay there. I would surely recommend it to everyone who does not expect a 5 star luxury hotel.
Reviews.Author: Blauweelmo

Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment! Location,down a narrow little dirty lane..Maintenance in the rooms is very very very poor..the AC kept on dripping continiuously..Breakfast is also terrible..Worst Ever!!
Reviews.Author: s0kutatsu

Reviews.Content: Cheap hotel in need of a desperate renovation Friends of mine were going to Bali and talked me into staying at the Saphir Mabisa. It certainly wouldn't have been my first choice of places to stay. However, I decided what the hell and went along with it. The location is quite nice with many shops and restaurants within walking distance. It was also well located for access to the legian beach. The hotel itself isn't really much to be desired and in desperate need ot a little TLC. The rooms are very basic and the bathrooms are looking very tired. The main reception area, which is always you first impressions really needed a total make over. I guess for the money you pay it represents good value, but I would most certainly never stay here again. I believe this hotel has now been closed for renovation.
Reviews.Author: maitairesort

Reviews.Content: You pay for what you get This is definitely a place to stay for one night only. We booked this through a Qantas brochure knowing we only needed an overnight stop in the Kuta area before moving onto to (greener ) pastures in Ubud. As seasoned, non-5-star travellers, we don't expect luxury, but this hotel has definitely seen better days.You get the feeling that a lot of money needs to be spent making this at least comfortable for the western traveller. Paint peeling everywhere, the same jangling indonesian gamelan/flute music piped from the restaurant loudly until 10pm outside our room, bathroom very basic, shower curtain mouldy, gecko and centipedes gained access somehow, light shades all broken, door locks hard to operate, outside chair broken, lace door curtains filthy, breakfast very basic with sugary cordial supplemented for orange juice. 16 year old daughter was asked by staff if she had a boyfriend (NOT appropriate!) On the basic positive: Aircon worked in our room, pool was clean. (pool chair mattresses stained with mildew). We could buy an extra 6 hrs checkout for 250kRp to stay in room till 9pm (midnight flight out). No direct access to beach. Long walk back to Jalan Legian. Beds clean. Towels grey, threadbare, and in some cases with holes. No room safe. Staff were friendly...I suspect this hotel has fallen on hard times and needs some support, but I question it's listing in a Qantas brochure.
Reviews.Author: Lizard62

Reviews.Content: Really bad experience. The hotel was part of a free package holiday a friend won, so thank goodness I wasn鈥檛 paying money for it. Aside from the very helpful staff, there is nothing nice about this hotel. I鈥檝e never seen the enamel coming off sink, toilet bowl or a tub before! The ceiling of the bathroom was mouldy, towel was stained and thread bear. The rooms are very worn and walls were stained. A lick of paint would have worked wonders. I asked for a change in room after the first night because I woke up itching! Enough said!
Reviews.Author: gabchong

Reviews.Content: This hotel is old, but it is certaintly clean, excellent service, price is fair This hotel is old, but it is certaintly clean, excellent service, price is fair. This hotel has a perfect location. Needs to touch up the building paints. Garden looks well maintain. Met the Indonesian Young General Manager. A very pleasant persons I ever met.Globally I could say  80 of 100
Reviews.Author: LowTianChoo

Reviews.Content: Not happy Just came back from Bali, had a 2 night stay at Saphir Mabisa Hotel and not very happy about it.1st night (room 320) with a malfunction aircond (not cold at all)...2nd night (room 322) without water in the bathroom (both washing basin and bath tub)...not to mentioned that the bed is too soft causing back ache after one night sleep.All I can say is price does make a difference.
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member

Reviews.Content: What a letdown! I certainly did not expect great accomodation when I went to Saphir Mabisa Inn, given the low price. However, I was nevertheless in for a shock. Firstly, I had to change rooms due to flooding (!). Also, the bathroom was a mess. Basically, maintenance in the rooms is very poor. Breakfast is also terrible. The only redeeming feature is the general location. I would not stay here again, despite the low price.
Reviews.Author: dbasha
